Boogaloo . . .


When Latino con Soul was first released in 1967, it was considered well ahead of its time. Reissued by the Blue Note label (July 2003), Joe TorresÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ album feels as contemporary as can be. 
Percussionist Joe Torres pioneered the Latin Jazz movement in the early sixties. Using the cream of Los AngelesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ musicians and arrangers, he created a fabulous album featuring Cha Cha ChÃƒÂ¡s, Mambos and Latinized arrangements of tunes like Sunny and Eleanor Rigby.
The first track is the hit Get Out Of My Way, which has appeared on numerous compilations worldwide and was featured in the biographical film PiÃƒÂ±ero, recounting the life of the famous Newyorican poet. This tune is a definite winner because it is just the right speed for suave dancing. 
The CD offers a great Latin Jazz fusion, combining dazzling jazz and Latin sizzle. With mostly instrumental tracks, it caters to Jazz lovers. Yo SalÃƒÂ­, composed by Torres with vocals by Ric DeSilva, it is danceable as a Salsa piece as well . . .
